content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Check Booking.com for a 3-star hotel or higher in Paris with a guest rating above 8.0 and available parking for dates December 20-23, 2025.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search process starts by entering the destination. The textbox labeled [14] "Where are you going?" is the correct place to enter "Paris" as the destination.
Action: Type [14]; Paris
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The next step is to select the check-in and check-out dates (December 20-23, 2025). The current calendar is displaying September and October 2025, but the required dates are in December. I need to navigate to the correct month using the "Next month" button to reach December 2025.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently displays October and November 2025. I need to reach December 2025 to select the required dates (December 20-23). I should continue by clicking the "Next month" button to move the calendar forward.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays December 2025. I can select the required check-in and check-out dates: December 20 (element [82]) as check-in and December 23 (element [85]) as check-out.
Action: Click [82]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in date (December 20, 2025) has been selected. Next, I need to select the check-out date, which is December 23, 2025 (element [85]), to complete the date range.
Action: Click [85]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in and check-out dates are set. Now, I need to filter the results based on guest rating above 8.0, "hotel" property type, 3-star or higher, and available parking. The filter options are visible on the left. "Hotels" and "Wonderful: 9+" (good for guest rating) are clear, but for star rating and parking filters, I may need to scroll. The first step should be to apply the "Hotels" filter [24].
Action: Click [24]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Hotels" filter is active. Next, I need to set the guest rating filter above 8.0 (preferably above 8 and not just 9+ if possible) and filter by available parking and at least 3 stars. These additional options are likely further down in the filter list, so I should scroll down to find filters for star rating and parking.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filter for star rating is now visible, specifically the "4 stars" option [14]. For this task, we need 3-star or higher, but the "3 stars" filter is not yet visible. Also, "parking" filter is not visible and may require more scrolling.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Parking" filter [25] is now visible, which will help find hotels with parking available. I still have not seen the "3 stars" filter, so further scrolling will be needed after this. For now, apply the general "Parking" filter.
Action: Click [25]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The applied filters now include "Parking" and "Hotels," and the date and destination are set. The "Wonderful: 9+" filter [28] is available and would ensure guest ratings above 8.0. However, we still need to secure the star rating (3-star or higher); the star filter is not visible. Next, scroll down to further filter options to find star ratings.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.65

Thought: The "4 stars" filter [14] is visible. Selecting this will ensure hotels are 4-star or higher. There may also be a "3 stars" filter if I scroll further. For now, click "4 stars" to narrow to 4-star and above, which fits the minimum requirement.

Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.75

Thought: All necessary filters are now set—location (Paris), dates (Dec 20–23, 2025), property type (hotels), minimum star rating (4 stars), and amenities (parking). However, the top result, "Les Jardins Du Marais," only has a guest score of 7.4, which is below the requirement of 8.0. Therefore, I need to scroll down to look for a hotel with a guest rating above 8.0.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.85
